title: In Latest Calif. Earthquake, Shake Alert Tests Its Legs
teaser: Before the earthquake that struck Napa, Calif., an earthquake early warning system blared an alarm 10 seconds early. Doug Given, the Earthquake  Early Warning coordinator for the U.S. Geological Survey, tells Melissa Block about the system that he's helped to institute.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
